Board.description: A reference to the BGL schema GraphDescriptor type.

BreadboardManifest.description:
A Breadboard Manifest.

Contains references to boards and other manifests.

id.description: Unique id of the comment node in graph metadata.

metadata.description: The metadata of the comment node. Use this to provide additional information about the comment node.

text.description: The text content of the comment.

Edge.description: Represents an edge in a graph.

constant.description: If true, this edge acts as a constant: the data that passes through it remains available even after the node has consumed it.

from.description: The node that the edge is coming from.

in.description: The input of the `to` node. If this value is undefined, then the then no data is passed as output of the `from` node.

optional.description: If true, this edge is optional: the data that passes through it is not considered a required input to the node.

out.description: The output of the `from` node. If this value is "*", then all outputs of the `from` node are passed to the `to` node. If this value is undefined, then no data is passed to any inputs of the `to` node.

to.description: The node that the edge is going to.

GraphDescriptor.description: A union type of both declarative and imperative graphs. Represents a graph that is either declarative (defined by nodes and edges) or imperative (backed by code).

args.description: Arguments that are passed to the graph, useful to bind values to graphs.

edges.description: The collection of all edges in the graph.

expectedLabels.deprecated: For internal testing only. Do not use.
expectedLabels.description: For internal testing only. Do not use.

explanation.deprecated: For internal testing only. Do not use.
explanation.description: For internal testing only. Do not use.

exports.description: The modules and sub-graphs that this graph declares as "exports": they themselves are usable declarative or imperative graphs. When the "exports" property exist, this graph is actually a Kit declaration: it can be used to distributed multiple graphs.

graphs.description: Sub-graphs that are also described by this graph representation.

inputs.deprecated: For internal testing only. Do not use.
inputs.description: For internal testing only. Do not use.

kits.description: All the kits (collections of node handlers) that are used by the graph.

main.description: The id of the Module that is used as an entry point for this graph. If this value is set, the graph is a "module graph": it is backed by code rather than by nodes and edges.

modules.description: Modules that are included as part of this graph.

nodes.description: The collection of all nodes in the graph.

outputs.deprecated: For internal testing only. Do not use.
outputs.description: For internal testing only. Do not use.

safe.deprecated: For internal testing only. Do not use.
safe.description: For internal testing only. Do not use.

sequence.deprecated: For internal testing only. Do not use.
sequence.description: For internal testing only. Do not use.

start.deprecated: For internal testing only. Do not use.
start.description: For internal testing only. Do not use.

throws.deprecated: For internal testing only. Do not use.
throws.description: For internal testing only. Do not use.

url.description: The URL pointing to the location of the graph. This URL is used to resolve relative paths in the graph. If not specified, the paths are assumed to be relative to the current working directory.

version.description: Version of the graph. [semver](https://semver.org/) format is encouraged.

virtual.description: An optional property that indicates that this graph is "virtual": it can not be represented by a static list of edges and nodes, and is instead more of a representation of something that's "graph-like". Modules, when they invoke capabilities, are "virtual" graphs: they don't have a defined topology and instead, this topology is discovered through imperative code execution

describer.description:
The URL of the graph that will act as the describer for this graph. Can be a relative URL and refer to a sub-graph within this graph.

The describers in the format of "module:name" will be interpreted as "use the `describe` export of the module named `name` to describe this graph".

help.description: The documentation for the graph, expressed as a URL and optional description.

icon.description: The icon that identifies the graph. Can be a URL or a Material Design id.

tags.description: Tags associated with the graph. At this moment, free-form strings.

visual.description: The metadata associated with the visual representation of the graph.

minimized.description: Whether or not the graph is minimized. Generally only applies to subgraphs as they carry that control in the Visual Editor.

window.description: Last known position of the graph in the editor.

GraphTag.description:
A tag that can be associated with a graph.
- `published`: The graph is published (as opposed to a draft). It may be    used in production and shared with others.
- `tool`: The graph is intended to be a tool.
- `experimental`: The graph is experimental and may not be stable.
- `component`: The graph is intended to be a component.

InputIdentifier.description: Unique identifier of a node's input.

InputValues.description: Values that are supplied as inputs to the `NodeHandler`.

url.description: The URL pointing to the location of the kit.

version.description: Version of the kit. [semver](https://semver.org/) format is encouraged.

KitTag.description:
Represents various tags that can be associated with a kit.
- `deprecated`: The kit is deprecated and should not be used.
- `experimental`: The kit is experimental and may not be stable.

ModuleCode.description: The code for this module, which should include a describer, an invoker, and any other relevant information to power the module.

help.description: The documentation for the module, expressed as a URL and optional description.

runnable.description: Whether the module should be presented as a runnable item to runModule.

source.description: The pre-compiled source for this module.

tags.description: Tags associated with the module. At this moment, free-form strings.

url.description: The source file for the module, if relevant.

ModuleTag.description:
A tag that can be associated with a graph.
- `published`: The module is published (as opposed to a draft). It may be    used in production and shared with others.
- `experimental`: The graph is experimental and may not be stable.

NodeConfiguration.description: Values that are supplied as part of the graph. These values are merged with the `InputValues` and supplied as inputs to the `NodeHandler`.

NodeDescriptor.description: Represents a node in a graph.

id.description: Unique id of the node in graph.

metadata.description: The metadata of the node. Use this provide additional information about the node.

type.description: Type of the node. Used to look up the handler for the node.

NodeIdentifier.description: Unique identifier of a node in a graph.

NodeMetadata.description: Represents metadata of a node. This is an optional part of the `NodeDescriptor` that can be used to provide additional information about the node.

description.description: A more detailed description of the node.

tags.description: Tags associated with the node. Can be either a string or a structured tag, like a `StartTag`.

visual.description: Metadata that conveys visual information about the node. Can be used by visual editors to store information about the node's appearance, current position, etc.

NodeTag.description: Represents a tag that can be associated with a node.

NodeTypeIdentifier.description: Unique identifier of a node's type.

NodeValue.description: A type representing a valid JSON value.

OutputIdentifier.description: Unique identifier of a node's output.

propertyNames.description: Unique identifier of a node's input.
Unique identifier of a node's output.

RelativeReference.description: A reference to a resource relative to the Uri of the parent resource.

ResourceReference.description:
A resource that definitely has a reference.

Also has a title.

SubGraphs.description: Represents a collection of sub-graphs. The key is the identifier of the sub-graph. The value is the descriptor of the sub-graph.
